item.title: Veli-Matti Karhulahti
item.description: In sum, the Centre of Finnish Registered Reports warmly welcomes everyone working in Finland or speaking Finnish (or Swedish) to join FRR especially as an author or reviewer (potential journals & recommenders contact me!). Huge thanks to @CorinaLogan @chrisdc77 for helping launch this :)5/5https://openscience.jyu.fi/fi/avoin-julkaiseminen/rekisteroidyt-tutkimusraportit

item.title: Glyn Moody
item.description: #Uruguay’s green power revolution: rapid shift to wind shows the world how it’s done - https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2023/dec/27/uruguays-green-power-revolution-rapid-shift-to-wind-shows-the-world-how-its-done "Stung by the 2008 oil price spike, Uruguay now produces up to 98% of its electricity from renewables. Can other countries follow suit?" #amazing, we must learn from it

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: The new French driving licence is a masterpiece of usability design. There are no fewer than 5 numbers that could be the "licence number".

item.title: bioRxiv
item.description:
2023 recap: @biorxivpreprint & @medrxivpreprint posted >45k new preprints. We launched new features and social media, partnered with new journals, & ran a user survey. We also celebrated bioRxiv's 10th anniversary 🎉
Thank you for being part of this open and equitable endeavor! #OpenScience #preprints

item.title: El Duvelle
item.description:
Hey all, still as part of the #MoveToMasto Movement, and because we’re a bunch of honest people, let’s list all the things we think could be improved here on #Mastodon:
(I’ll start - in no specific order)
(See this other post for the positive aspects)[1] You don’t know if people boost or even like your boosts
[2] You can’t easily see all the answers to someone else’s post
[3] Sometimes you find a potentially great account to follow just to realize they haven’t been active for a year
[4] Threads and answers visualization is sometimes unclear
[5] You can very easily miss very relevant content (the possibility of a customizable algorithm would help)
[6] (very specific to me) there are not enough #BehaviouralNeuroscience or #NeuroEthology people
[7] the new search is great but doesn’t search ALL of Mastodon’s public posts
[8] …?Please do add your own!

item.title: Manlio De Domenico
item.description: 🚨#ComplexityThought: 2023 Influential Papers CollectionThanks for reading us in 2023 and for being an active community. In the next Special Issue you will find recommendations from readers and more.See you again in 2024!https://open.substack.com/pub/manlius/p/complexity-thought-2023-influential?r=n4iyo&utm_campaign=post&utm_medium=web&showWelcome=true

item.title: conda
item.description:
Conda is moving our social media presence from Twitter/X to Mastodon and LinkedIn at the start of 2024. It's past time to move into spaces that are welcoming and more in line with our community values. Going forward, you can find us at
🐘 @conda (https://fosstodon.org/@conda) on Mastodon
🔗 Conda Community (https://linkedin.com/company/condacommunity) on LinkedInAnnouncement: https://conda.org/blog/2023-12-27-social-move
We hope to see you on Mastodon and LinkedIn in 2024!

item.title: Anne Applebaum
item.description:

item.title: Anirvan Chatterjee
item.description: “About 85% of Gaza’s 2.3 million people have been displaced from their homes – many, like Jameel, multiple times, and the UN’s latest food security assessment estimates that one in four people in Gaza are starving.”[👆I updated this quote to reflect the correct “one in four” number after the Guardian printed a correction]https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/dec/27/miserable-in-every-sense-displaced-families-in-gaza-face-daily-ordeal

item.title: Troed Sångberg
item.description: @anirvan "This article was amended on 28 December 2023. An earlier version said the UN’s latest food security assessment estimated that 90% of people in Gaza were starving. That was the percentage of people who had not eaten for two days in the period leading up to 7 December. The latest figures suggest one in four people are now starving."Still bad.

item.title: Qasim Rashid, Esq.
item.description: Let’s be clear. Palestinian journalists said this since Day 1 and those who believed them were ridiculed or called antisemitic.Now the NYT confirms “Israel claims it protects civilians, but a NYT investigation found at least 200 times Israel dropped its most destructive bombs in areas it designated as safe for civilians in Gaza.”That’s no accident—it’s policy. Where is the accountability? #CeasefireNOW
